title: Must-Watch Kids’ Theatre Shows To Book in 2025: Puppet Shows, Circus Acts & More
author: Sassy Mama
content: Get excited for these super kids’ theatre shows, family musicals, magic shows, puppet shows, circus acts, and music concerts for kids. Don’t miss our theatre discount codes! We may have an abundance of kid-friendly activities , but there’s nothing quite like catching a kids’ theatre show in Singapore. From puppet shows to concerts, musicals and special kids’ theatre shows, there’s lots to look forward to on stage. Bookmark this page to keep up to date on all the upcoming kids’ theatre happenings in 2025. Be sure to scroll to the bottom for some exciting shows taking place later this year, including Beauty and the Beast and CoComelon Live! We’ve even listed some free kids’ concerts for a pocket-friendly weekend outing ! P.S. While you’re looking for fun kids’ shows to catch, check out these cinemas with free kids’ tickets ! Parents, you can also check out our list of concerts and theatre shows for adults in Singapore . Read more: Fun Things To Do This Weekend In Singapore With the Kids Disclaimer: These external events are not owned or managed by Sassy Mama. Always check with the event organiser for event changes or cancellations before heading down. Kids’ Theatre Shows, Musicals, Concerts & Kids’ Plays In 2025: Flipside 2025: FREE kids’ theatre shows, circus, comedy, puppetry & more Image credit: Esplanade The month of June is going to be a busy one for kids’ theatre show enthusiasts, as Flipside 2025 arrives at Esplanade. This performing arts festival has tonnes of FREE live performances including comedy shows, puppetry, circus shows and more to fill your weekends in Singapore ! Look out for a roller rink battle, lots of acrobatics, juggling and balancing acts and more, plus workshops on these circus skills! Here are some FREE highlights to look forward to at Flipside 2025: Les Patineurs: Roller skate battle When: 30 May – 1 June 2025, 6.35pm & 8pm Where: Esplanade Forecourt Garden How much: Free! Ketch Comedy Show: Clown, juggling, magic & more When: 30 May – 1 June 2025, Fri 7pm & 9pm; Sat 2.30pm & 4pm; Sun 4pm & 7pm Where: Esplanade Concourse, DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade How much: Free! Aerial Open Stage: Aerial performance When: 5 – 7 June 2025, Thu 7pm & 8.15pm; Fri 9.45pm; Sat 7pm Where: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade How much: Free! Witty Look Show: Unicycle acrobatics When: 6 – 8 June 2025, 5pm & 7.30pm Where: Esplanade Courtyard How much: Free! Stylish Comedy Show: Comedy magicians & jugglers When: 6 – 8 June 2025, Fri 7pm & 8.30pm; Sat 2.30pm & 9.45pm; Sun 7pm & 9.45pm Where: Esplanade Concourse, DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade How much: Free! OVVIO: Balancing tricks When: 6 – 8 June 2025, 8.15pm Where: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade How much: Free! A Show with Strings: Puppetry & clowning When: 7 – 8 June 2025, Sat 4pm & 7pm; Sun 4pm & 8.30pm Where: Esplanade Concourse How much: Free! More info on Flipside 2025 here . Read more: Live Concerts & Theatre Shows For Adults In Singapore Children’s Season at CMSG: Kids’ theatre & musical performances There’s plenty happening at Children’s Museum Singapore’s Children’s Season 2025 including some fab kids’ musicals and theatre performances. Kids will get plenty of laughs and hands-on play surrounding the food heritage of Singapore at ‘Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey’. They even get to bring home a heritage snack kit! There’s also the interactive performance ‘For a Better Future’ where kids are encouraged to take part in the show. More info on CMSG’s Children’s Season 2025 here . Where: Children’s Museum Singapore When: For a Better Future: 31 May & 1 June 2025; Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey: 7, 13 & 14 June 2025 How much: $25/person – get tickets here . Anne Maria Lim and the Magic Organ kids’ concert Image credit: Singapore Symphony Orchestra Who knew the pipe organ could be so magical? Introduce the kids to this fascinating classical music instrument with Anne Maria Lim and the Magic Organ . This kids’ concert promises an evening filled with magic, as it tells a tale of a wizard, Mr Majeika by the popular UK composer Bob Chilcott. This kids’ performance is part of the SSO Organ Series, and includes fringe activities such as exhibitions and pipe organ demos! When: 8 June 2025, 5pm Where: Victoria Concert Hall How much: $10. Get tickets here . Lang Lang Plays Disney In Concert: Kids’ concert in Singapore Image credit: SISTIC Got a little Disney fan at home? They’ll surely recognise all the tunes at Lang Lang Plays Disney In Concert . The legendary Chinese pianist will be performing in Singapore for two days only. Watch him perform some of Disney’s most iconic songs, such as Let It Go, We Don’t Talk About Bruno, You’ll Be in My Heart and When You Wish Upon a Star. Click here to get 10% off tickets! When: 12 & 14 June 2025, 7:30pm Where: The Star Theatre, The Star Performing Arts Centre How much: From $38. Get tickets here . Peter & Blue’s School Holiday 2025: Kids’ ballet performance Image credit: Singapore Ballet via Instagram School’s out! Bring the kids for this school holiday special. This kid-friendly ballet performance by the Singapore Ballet follows the journey of Peter and his faithful dog, Blue. See what they’re up to on their school holiday escapade, and expect lots of laughter, friendship and imaginative play. When: 26 – 29 June 2025 Where: Esplanade Theatre Studio How much: $35. Get tickets here . The Puppet Master – A Night With Disney Songs Image credit: Cellography via Facebook Cellography, Singapore’s first cello pop orchestra, is putting on a musical story about a puppet who comes to life and goes on a journey with the man who made him. Think adventure, tough choices, even a witch! Disney songs like Beauty and the Beast and A Whole New World are reimagined by local composer Hughes Chong. Kids can dress up as their favourite characters—it’s a family-friendly show with music, heart, and a little magic. When: 12 July 2025, 7.30pm Where: Gateway Theatre How much: From $38 – get tickets here . Symphony in the Gardens: FREE concert for families Picture this: you pack a picnic, grab your beloved family (and furkids!), head to the Singapore Botanic Gardens , and then enjoy live music by the Singapore Symphony Orchestra (SSO). That makes the perfect FREE weekend activity , in our books. That said, we’re always excited for Symphony in the Gardens, where the SSO will perform classical tunes at the gorgeous Shaw Foundation Symphony Stage. The best part? It’s all free! Symphony in the Gardens When: 12 July 2025, 6pm Where: Shaw Foundation Symphony Stage, Singapore Botanic Gardens How much: Free! Roald Dahl’s Fantastic Mr Fox Image credit: Singapore Repertory Theatre Roald Dahl’s Fantastic Mr Fox takes the stage at Victoria Theatre. At this kids’ play in Singapore, follow the adventures of the cunning and courageous Mr Fox, who needs to outsmart some greedy farmers to save his family. Paired with music, song, dance, humour and memorable characters, this fun kids’ theatre show is all about saving the animal community, so it’s sure to be a hit with the little ones. Fantastic Mr Fox will also be available in Mandarin shows! 15% off early bird promo, TBA. When: 16 July – 16 August 2025 Where: Victoria Theatre How much: From $22. Get tickets here . Disney’s Fantasia film screening with live orchestra Image credit: Singapore Symphony Orchestra Disney’s Fantasia is no doubt iconic. This August, you can watch the visually captivating film accompanied by live classical music performed by the Singapore Symphony Orchestra! Expect iconic tunes by Beethoven, Stravinsky, Tchaikovsky, Bach and more. Note that the show is two hours long with a 20-minute intermission, thus, it’s suitable for older kids. When: 7 & 8 August 2025, 7.30pm Where: Esplanade Concert Hall How much: From $28 – get tickets here . Koko The Great: Kids’ theatre show Image credit: Esplanade PIP’s Club via Facebook The perfect kids’ theatre show for little ones with big imaginations, Koko The Great follows the adventures of a little village boy, Koko. Watch him overcome his fear of the unknown and embrace the unexpected fun it brings! When: 15 – 31 August 2025 Where: Esplanade Theatre Studio How much: From $23. Get tickets here . Disney Jr. Live On Tour: Kids’ theatre show in Singapore Image credit: Disney Jr. Live On Tour Join Mickey, Minnie, Goofy, the Puppy Dog Pals, and more for the biggest playdate ever, but will ominous weather dampen the fun? Find out if Team Spidey from “Marvel’s Spidey and His Amazing Friends” can uncover who’s behind the mysterious weather and save this playdate! When: 5 – 7 September 2025, Friday, 6:30pm; Saturday, 10:30am, 2:30pm & 6:30pm; Sunday, 10:30am & 2:30pm Where: Singapore Indoor Stadium, 2 Stadium Walk, Singapore 397691 How much: From $28 – get tickets here from 28 May 2025 at 10am. The Tiger Who Came to Tea: Kids’ theatre show in Singapore Image credit: ABA PRODUCTIONS & Nicoll Entertainment (UK) A tiger shows up at Sophie’s door just in time for tea—and chaos follows! This playful stage adaptation of the classic story, The Tiger Who Came To Tea, is full of songs, magic, and laughs. It’s perfect for kids aged 3 and up, and runs just under an hour with no intervals. When: 12 – 14 September 2025, Friday 4.30pm & 7pm; Saturday & Sunday 11am, 2pm & 4.30pm Where: Victoria Theatre How much: From $42 – get tickets here . SSO Babies’ Proms: Kids’ concert for littles Image credit: SSO The Singapore Symphony Orchestra’s (SSO) Babies’ Proms is back! There’s no need for the kids to sit still–families are encouraged to move along to the music and explore different orchestra instruments! When: 13 & 14 September, 11am & 2pm Where: Victoria Concert Hall How much: From $35. Tickets on sale here from 3 June. Ballet Under the Stars: Family-friendly ballet performance Image credit: Singapore Ballet Looking for a family-friendly night out? Ballet Under The Stars offers a relaxed picnic vibe where you and the kids can enjoy beautiful dance performances together. Singapore Ballet will showcase both classic and modern pieces, like ‘Paquita’ and ‘Incomparable Beauty’. It’s a great chance to introduce your little ones to ballet while enjoying fresh air and a wholesome picnic. When: 19 – 21 & 26 – 28 September 2025, 7.30pm Where: Fort Canning Green How much: $48 – get tickets here . Read more: Theatre Shows & Live Concerts In Singapore CoComelon & Blippi Sing-A-Long Live: Kids musical in Singapore Image credit: BIZ TRENDS Fans of CoComelon, buckle up because you’re in for a treat! Snag your tickets to join JJ and friends as they take the stage for the first time in Singapore at Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands. Warm up your voices and get ready to sing along and groove to your favourite songs including “If You’re Happy and You Know It,” “Wheels on the Bus”, “Head, Shoulders, Knees and Toes” and more! When: 27 & 28 September 2025 Where: Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands, 10 Bayfront Ave, B1-69/70 The Shoppes, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore 018971 How much: From $78. Get tickets here . Cirque Alice: Kids’ circus show in Singapore Image credit: Cirque Alice Cirque Alice is Alice in Wonderland meets acrobatics, contortionists, puppetry, aerialists and more! At this ‘Wonderland’, be mesmerised by acrobatic performers who’ll keep you at the edge of your seat, paired with classical hits that have been given a contemporary spin. When: 9 – 10 October 2025 Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands How much: From $78. Get tickets here . The Three Billy Goats Gruff: Kids’ play Image credit: Singapore Repertory Theatre This childhood tale is one for the memories! The Three Billy Goats Gruff is given a fun musical spin by the Singapore Repertory Theatre. The story follows the three goats’ adventure to cross a bridge in search of food amidst a drought, where they’ll encounter a terrifying troll! Expect lots of laughs with this one, as well as catchy tunes by award-winning duo George Stiles and Anthony Drewe. When: From 10 October 2025, Monday – Friday 9.30am & 11.30am; Saturday – Sunday 11am & 2pm Where: Drama Centre Theatre How much: From $22. Tickets will be on sale here . Temasek Foundation x SSO Halloween Spooktacular! Image credit: SSO via Facebook Here’s a fun way to celebrate Halloween this year: bring the kiddos to a fun spooky kids’ concert! Temasek Foundation x Singapore Symphony Orchestra present the fun-filled Halloween Spooktacular! Ready yourself for witches, ghouls, skeletons and more, and don’t worry about the kids sitting still as this one’s a relaxed performance. P.S. be sure to wear your best Halloween costume , too! When: 1 & 2 November 2025, Saturday 11am & 2pm; Sunday 11am Where: Victoria Concert Hall How much: From $30. Tickets on sale here from 3 June. The Emperor’s New Clothes: Kids theatre show Image credit: Wild Rice The Hans Christian Andersen literary folktale takes on a musical spin in this Wild Rice production. The Emperor’s New Clothes is all about the flamboyant Emperor who’s tricked by two cheeky tailors who are out to teach him a lesson. Just in time for the year-end holiday season, this kids’ play is going to be filled with laughter, catchy tunes and of course, fashionable fits. When: From 13 November 2025 Where: Wild Rice @ Funan How much: TBA – tickets will be available here . Beauty and the Beast The Musical: Kids’ musical in Singapore Image credit: Disney Step into a magical world this December as Beauty and the Beast The Musical comes to Singapore—its only stop in Asia! Get ready to sing along to your favourite songs like ‘Be Our Guest’ with dazzling costumes, amazing sets, and all your beloved characters brought to life in a totally new way. This kids’ theatre musical a fairytale adventure you won’t want to miss! Where: 11 December 2025 – 4 January 2026, various days and timings Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands How much: From $70. Get tickets here . Read more: Best Theatre Shows, Live Concerts & Comedy Shows For Adults In Singapore Magic Hour @ Raffles Hotel Singapore: Free kids’ concert Image credit: Singapore Symphony Orchestra Raffles Hotel Singapore has free kids’ concerts that take place every other month! Bring the little ones to enjoy classical music performed by the Singapore Symphony Orchestra, pack a picnic and enjoy light bites and drinks that’ll be present at the venue. Stay updated here . When: 21 July, 23 August, 18 October, 6 December 2025, 6pm Where: The Lawn, Raffles Arcade at Raffles Hotel How much: FREE! SSO Christmas Concert Image credit: SSO Celebrate the year-end festivities at the SSO Christmas Concert at the Esplanade Concert Hall. You can bet your favourite wintry tunes will make an appearance; you’re even encouraged to sing along! When: 12 & 13 December 2025, 7.30pm Where: Esplanade Concert Hall How much: From $48. Get tickets here . Candlelight Concerts Take the kids to one of the many Candlelight Concerts for a magical experience of listening to music by candlelight in different locations around Singapore from SEA Aquarium to Chijmes! Best for kids 8 years old or older. When: Various dates How much: from $63 per person – Get tickets here . Where: Various locations Read more: Things To Do This Weekend In Singapore With Kids Past kids’ theatre, concerts & circus shows in Singapore 2025: WICKED The Musical in Singapore Image credit: WICKED The Musical – Singapore via Facebook Introduce the kids to the world of Broadway and theatre shows with the iconic WICKED The Musical. This Broadway hit is in Singapore for a whole month, and you can bring the kids to follow the story of what happens in Oz after Dorothy’s visit. When: 19 March – 27 April 2025 Where: Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands How much: From $78. ZOOOM: Kids’ theatre show in Singapore Image credit: ACT 3 International Are you ready for ZOOOM ? With music, lasers and projections, this kids’ theatre performance is sure to be a memorable one for young ones aged 4 to 8. ZOOOM is inspired by the children’s book Harold and The Purple Crayon, following the adventure of a lost star that’s trying to find its way home. It promises to be an interactive performance, one that explores what dreams are made of. When: 1 – 5 April 2025 Where: Victoria Theatre How much: From $28 Peter, the Wolf and Friends Image credit: Singapore Symphony Orchestra Brought to you by Temasek Foundation and SSO Concerts for Children, Peter, the Wolf and Friends is a great way to get the kids to appreciate classical music. Combining the tunes of the Toy Symphony, the tale of The Tortoise and the Hare, and the production of Peter and the Wolf, this musical tale will feature a live performance accompanied by an orchestra. Note that the show is recommended for kids aged 4 and above. When: 22 – 23 March 2025 Where: Victoria Concert Hall How much: From $25 Disney On Ice: Find Your Hero Image credit: Disney On Ice Disney On Ice invites you to explore the true meaning of heroism alongside Mickey, Minnie, Donald, and Goofy, as beloved Disney characters take to the ice with breathtaking figure skating, dazzling costumes, and enchanting set designs. Watch as Mirabel bravely saves her family’s cherished Casita, join Moana on her epic voyage, and follow Rapunzel on her thrilling adventure! When: 15 – 23 March 2025, various timings Where: Singapore Indoor Stadium, 2 Stadium Walk, Singapore 397691 How much: From $23 Red Riding Hood: Kids’ play in Singapore Image credit: Wild Rice Bring your child to see this iconic children’s story come to life–with a local twist! Little Red is delivering tingkat food to her grandmother. Instead of the woods, she’s riding through Woodlands, where she meets the Wolf. Paired with comedic moments, original songs and recognisable local scenarios, this play promises to be a hit with the young ones. When: 7 – 16 March 2025 Where: Wild Rice @ Funan How much: From $35 Check out these other fun things to do with the kids in SG! title: FREE Bouncy Castle, Giant Ball Pit, Workshops & More At PA Family PLAYGround!
author: Sassy Mama
content: Looking for a fun way to bond with the kids over the school break? Look forward to hands-on workshops, life-sized board games and a whole lot of fun at PA Family PLAYGround 2025! The school holidays are here, a perfect time to put the textbooks away and create core memories with the kids! This June, PA Family PLAYGround 2025 invites you to bond with your family and meet other parents at the ultimate fun-filled family day out. This mega family playground is packed with free activities for kids (and grown-ups) of all ages, from nostalgic childhood games to hands-on learning experiences. Spend quality time with your family to Play, Learn, Appreciate and care for Your family and the community–school’s out, adventures’ in! Find out what’s happening between 8 June and 5 July 2025: Life-sized board games & family workshops Get ready for some friendly competition as you team up with the kids to play a life-sized board game or challenge them to a game of Mega Jenga. Little ones can unleash creativity to doodle and colour or learn a new skill like Paper Quilling or Acrylic Pour Painting workshop at the interactive family workshops. Older kids can try their hand at a DIY Recycling Bin workshop, while you can inspire your child to kickstart an active lifestyle with a parent-child workout class. When the kids need some downtime, head to the SG60 Wishing Wall and Digital Pledge Wall to practice the art of gratitude and reflection. Write a “thank you” note to family members and the community, or create a plan to care for your community and spark joy. In the spirit of giving, take part in the CARE in Every Bottle initiative, where you can purchase a juice bottle for $10, decorate it, and have all proceeds go directly to the Community Chest. Get a sneak preview through ROBLOX PA Family PLAYGround FamilyVerse If you can’t wait to get started, check out the ROBLOX PA Family PLAYGround FamilyVerse , the first PA Family PLAYGround metaverse. This interactive pre-event teaser allows you to experience some family bonding fun ahead of the event, from the comfort of your home. Simply hop online and work together to complete in-game quests to redeem a limited quantity of cute isometric stickers that depict 3D scenes. Locate the PA Family PLAYGround in your hood PA FamilyPLAYGround is happening at five locations islandwide from 10am to 6pm: 8 June 2025: Tengah Community Club 14 June 2025: Braddell Heights Community Club 21 June 2025: Toa Payoh West Community Club 28 June 2025: Nee Soon South Community Club 5 July 2025: One Punggol As part of PA’s continued commitment to support families, exclusive promotions will also run throughout this period and extend through July 2025. These include a 30% discount on selected Parent-Child and Children’s courses, Two-for-One Family Kayaking packages at participating PAssion Wave outlets, and exclusive merchant deals for PAssion card members. Save the date and bring the kids down to the nearest PA Family PLAYGround for unforgettable memories and a fun family day out! title: Where To Find Art Classes For Kids In Singapore
author: Sassy Mama
content: Is your child into art and being creative? From pottery and painting to drawing and crafts, here’s our roundup of art classes for kids in Singapore! These kids’ art classes in Singapore give kiddos the opportunity to explore their creativity through painting, pottery, drawing and decoupage. Making art simply for the sake of art is absolutely wonderful, but it’s also been shown to help kids with motor skills, language development, spatial awareness, decision making and so much more. If you are looking to encourage your child’s creative talents, there are plenty of fab art classes for kids in Singapore. Read more: Where To Go for Kids’ Speech & Drama Classes Art Classes For Kids In Singapore: Abrakadoodle Singapore: Learn about different artists and their styles Image credit: Abrakadoodle Singapore Not sure if your child will enjoy an art class? Why not sign up for a non-obligatory art trial class ($58 for 1 class, $120 for 3 classes) at Abrakadoodle? Here, kids will get to learn about different artists and their art styles. They will be exposed to a variety of art materials and mediums and develop their confidence, by sharing their ideas and masterpieces, during gallery time! Abrakadoodle, multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, River Valley and Jurong East, Tel: (+65) 6235 9568, www.abrakadoodle.com.sg The Art People: Learn animation and game design Image credit: The Art People The Art People was started in 2011 by a team of fun and passionate art teachers who dreamed of inspiring young children through art, and has grown to four art class locations around the island today. The Art People employ The Artlytical Method® to provide specialised training in art as well as Animation and Game Design. With the motto “No one should be deprived of learning” this school caters art classes for kids to both mainstream and special needs students. The Art People, multiple locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Beauty World and Tampines, www.theartpeople.com.sg Artary: Themed art courses Image credit: Artary Artary offers holistic and thoughtful art classes for kids 3.5 to 12 years old. Membership provides access to other studio activities and there are plenty of holiday options available too, including art jams and themed courses using games, stories and songs. Art class trial sessions are available if your child (or you) are keen to get messy before committing to an art programme. Artary , multiple locations in Singapore including Admiralty, Punggol, and Jurong, www.artary.sg Artify: Art classes with small group sizes Image credit: Artify Studio via Facebook In addition to regular art classes for kids aged 4 and up, Artify on Jalan Sultan has a cool slate of one-off art jams for kids, with all materials and guidance provided, so little ones need only bring a healthy dose of imagination! They also pride themselves on their one art instructor to four little artists ratio to ensure plenty of personal attention. Artify , 200 Jalan Sultan, #12-07, Singapore 199018, www.artifystudio.com Art Boot Camp: Art classes from 18 months onwards Image credit: Art Boot Camp With themed programmes across three different sites, Art Boot Camp offers art classes for kids between 18 months and 17 years. Little ones can begin with Art Playdate classes, where each parent-tot combo can get stuck into some one-of-a-kind creativity, while older ones will learn about painting and drawing techniques, colour theory, perspective and many other art themes in their own drop-off art classes! Art Boot Camp, two locations in Singapore, including Hillview Avenue and Upper Bukit Timah, www.artbootcamp.com.sg Art Zone: Different art packages available Image credit: Art Zone Art Zone is dedicated to interactive art classes for kids, with friendly teachers and packages available if you want to make it a regular gig for your little one (classes start from 4 years of age). With painting and drawing as the foundation of each kid’s art class, you can even opt to have your child’s artwork framed at the end of each session. Art Zone, multiple locations in Singapore including Bukit Batok, Bukit Timah and East Coast, www.artzone.com.sg Chalk n Pencils: 2D and 3D art classes Image credit: Chalk n Pencils Stoke the fires of your kids’ imaginations by letting them get creative with art studio Chalk n Pencils. Art classes for kids here explore both two-dimensional art like drawing, painting and printmaking as well as three-dimensional art of clay moulding and construction work. Teachers use Teaching for Artistic Behaviour, a recognised choice-based art education approach to teaching art. Art classes are small with a great 1:8 art teacher-to-student ratio so your kid will get lots of attention! Chalk n Pencils, 46 Kim Yam Road #04-11, Singapore 239351 and 451 Joo Chiat Rd, #03-08, Singapore 427664, www.chalknpencils.com The Drawing Mint: Art classes for different age groups Image credit: The Drawing Mint With art classes for kids from the age of 3 all the way up to 15, The Drawing Mint is all about catering to each unique individual, specialising in – well – drawing out each child’s personality and style and encouraging them to create artworks that reflect their inner world. Through small group learning in its cosy, quiet and inspiring classroom space, the studio’s chief aims are promoting independence, decision-making skills and a sense of reflection. The Drawing Mint, 6 Mohamed Sultan Road, #02-01, Singapore 238956 and 406 Joo Chiat Place #03-25/26 Singapore 428084, www.thedrawingmint.com Our Art Studio: Certification art classes Image credit: Our Art Studio Offering structured certification courses as well as personalised art classes for kids from the age of 2.5 years old, Our Art Studio caters to each individual’s interests and pace of learning. We love the small class sizes and flexible timings – class art packages are valid for a full year, and can even be shared between family members! Students can choose from disciplines like acrylic/oil/watercolour and Chinese painting, along with Nagomi, sketching/manga drawing or clay. Our Art Studio, #04-20, 10 Paya Lebar Road, Singapore 409057 and 1 Vista Exchange Green, #01-36, Singapore 138617, www.ourartstudio.com.sg Little Artists Art Studio: Award-winning art studio Little Artists Art Studio has two award-winning fine arts studios that offer art classes for kids on the East Coast. Kids’ art classes here cater to littles from 2.5 years of age and up. Little Artists Art Studio is among Singapore’s leading centres for fine arts learning and contemporary events. Whether your child is serious about going to art school or just wanting to learn for fun, there’s a class for everyone! There is also an art class for kids with special needs (dyslexia, ADHD, Asperger syndrome, learning difficulty, language delay). Little Artists Art Studio , 15 Siglap Road, #01-07, Singapore 448912 & 55 Siglap Road, #02-18, Singapore 455871, www.little-artists.com/ The Fort Studios: Open-studio art classes No two children are the same, and at The Fort Studios they know that means no two artworks should ever be the same. Children aged 6 to 14 are challenged to think, talk and create as artists do in the Fort Studios’ art classes for kids. We love the open-studio approach that encourages kids to be responsible for their own learning while allowing their artistic voices to be respected, valued and honoured. The Fort Studios, 56 Kallang Pudding Road, #08-06, HH@Kallang, Singapore 349328, www.thefortstudios.sg 3Arts: Pottery classes Get behind the wheel and master the art of pottery making at 3Arts art classes for kids! Craft your own clay masterpiece using an electric or manual pottery wheel with guidance from experienced teachers. Regular art classes are aimed at kids (and adults) of varying ages, and no previous experience is required. 3Arts, 394 Joo Chiat Place, Singapore 428078, www.3arts.sg HiArt: Art classes catered to 2.5 years old Instructors at HiArt strive to bring the joy of art and learning to everyone regardless of age and abilities! They offer art classes for kids as young as 2.5 years old and work closely with each student to nurture artistic skills and inspire creativity. The art classes for kids allow them to express their thoughts and feelings through painting, drawing and more! HiArt, multiple locations in Singapore including Esplanade, United Square and Woodleigh Mall, www.hiart.com.sg Jay Jay Jolly: Take-home craft kits This fun crafts shop Jay Jay Jolly has a variety of hassle-free craft kits perfect for rainy stay-at-home afternoons. In addition to their range of environmentally friendly craft tools and supplies, they also hold fun-filled art classes for kids and even do art-tastic birthday parties too! Jay Jay Jolly, 1008 Toa Payoh North, #02-01, Singapore 318996, www.jayjayjolly.com Global Art: Comic and cartoon art classes Art classes at Global Art encompass visual art, handicrafts, cartoons, comics, acrylic painting, and more. These classes aim to encourage imagination and expression among children while enhancing their mental development. Designed for ages three and up, art classes allow even the youngest artists to create their own games, stories, and puzzles through engaging art activities. Global Art, multiple locations in Singapore including Anchorpoint, Bishan and Bukit Panjang, www.globalart.com.sg Ki.Li.O Art: Art jamming in East Coast Ki.Li.O Art is a popular East Coast spot for an hour of art jamming, but the team also runs kid-friendly art workshops for children aged between 2 and 12. They’ll learn about the various elements of art and design while refining their motor skills and learning how to express themselves creatively. Ki.Li.O Art, 85 East Coast Road, #02-01, Singapore 428787, www.kilioart.com Little Arts Academy: Art camps for kids Little Arts Academy offers art classes for kids and camps for mini artists, with a range of options available for kids of all ages and abilities from the age of 6. There are also regular personalised programmes and short courses for students of art schools in Singapore. There are lots of performing arts options, too. Little Arts Academy , Yishun Avenue 2 and 1 Northpoint Drive, www.thelittleartsacademy.sg My Art Pencil: Art studio with birthday party packages Art jams, art supplies, art classes, birthday parties and more — My Art Pencil in Hougang is a hit with mamas for their respectful approach to art classes for kids, though they also believe artistic talent is a skill that can be cultivated rather than just an inherent gift. This studio offers art classes for kids aged 3 years old to teens! My Art Pencil, 50 Serangoon North Avenue 4 #09-16 Singapore 555856, www.myartpencil.com Rafayet Studio: Variety of art packages Rafayet Studio offers a variety of art packages, each of which is carefully designed to cater to different age groups and skill levels so that kids can reach their full artistic potential. Through these art classes, not only will your child acquire new artistic abilities, but they will develop confidence, improve their fine motor skills and enhance their problem-solving skills. Rafayet Studio, Bukit Timah Shopping Centre, #02-40, Singapore 588179, www.instagram.com/rafayetstudio Soul Deelight: Calligraphy and watercolour Dee is the lovely calligrapher behind Soul Deelight offering calligraphy and watercolour workshops in her home. Jump to: – Counselling, therapy, psychology: know the different terms – Where to find counselling services in SG Counsellor, Psychologist, Psychotherapist: Know the Difference Confused about the differences between a psychotherapist and a psychologist, counselling or therapy? Here’s a simple breakdown to get you started. Counselling vs. therapy: These terms are often used interchangeably, but typically, counselling focuses on problem-solving specific issues that are happening to you in the present and is usually applied for shorter terms than therapy. Psychotherapy: This long-term, in-depth solution zooms into a wider range of issues, and involves dissecting your past experiences and childhood to find answers for your current behavioural patterns and issues. Psychotherapist: This umbrella term applies to any professional trained to treat people for their mental health, and can encompass psychiatrists, counsellors and clinical psychologists. Psychiatrists: These mental health experts have a medical degree and specialise in preventing, diagnosing, and treating mental illness. Unlike most psychotherapists, they can also prescribe medication. Psychologists: They usually have a Master’s Degree or PhD in psychology and talk therapy. They perform psychological testing and are qualified to do counselling and psychotherapy for mental disorders. A counselling psychologist will tend to work with clients with emotional and social issues, whereas a clinical psychologist will normally work with people suffering from more complex mental health conditions, such as personality disorders and major depressive disorders. Counsellors: They typically help clients explore the challenges or difficulties being faced, whether it’s dissatisfaction with life or even a loss of purpose. title: Hari Raya Haji 2025: How Is It Celebrated In Singapore & What’s The Difference With Hari Raya Puasa?
author: Sassy Mama
content: Hari Raya Haji 2025 falls on 7 June 2025. Here’s all you need to know about the significance of Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji, and how they’re celebrated in Singapore. “Wait, it’s Hari Raya again? Didn’t we just celebrate it two months ago?” and “Why are there two Hari Raya celebrations in a year?” are probably common questions you’ll see every year. Hari Raya Puasa or Hari Raya Aidilfitri falls on 31 March 2025, and this festival celebrates the end of the month of Ramadan , AKA the Islamic holy month of fasting. Not to be confused with Hari Raya Haji, which is referred to as the Festival of Sacrifice. Hari Raya Haji falls on 7 June 2025! Here’s a lowdown of all you need to know about these two special days, and how it’s celebrated by Muslims in Singapore Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri Image credit: MUIS via Instagram Also known as Eid al-Fitr, Hari Raya Puasa marks the end of the Islamic month of Ramadan and is one of the most important celebrations of the year. “Puasa” means fasting, and during Ramadan, Muslims around the world fast from dawn to sunset. But fasting isn’t just about abstaining from food and drink (yes, even water!), it’s a spiritual practice that promotes self-discipline, empathy for the less fortunate, and a deeper connection with God. There is no fixed date on the Gregorian calendar for both Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji. Like all Islamic festivals, the dates for Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji are based on astronomical calculations that rely on the sighting of the new moon. Because of this Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji differ from year to year. In Singapore, the Islamic Religious Council (known in Malay as Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura, or MUIS) is responsible for determining the date of the festival each year. Read more: Where To Get Hari Raya Traditional Outfits In Singapore Hari Raya Haji Image credit: Masjid Sultan Singapore Facebook On the other hand, Hari Raya Haji is relatively a quieter celebration in Singapore. Hari Raya Haji (which means “great day of the haj ” in Malay), also known as Aidiladha (also spelt Eid al-Adha or Eid Adha) or the Great Day of Sacrifice, is a Muslim festival that falls on the 10th day of Zulhijjah (the 12th month in the Islamic calendar). Hari Raya Haji also coincides with the annual Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca, a significant event for Muslims worldwide and also one of the Five Pillars of Islam. What’s the difference between Hari Raya Haji and Hari Raya Puasa? Image credit: Visit Singapore Hari Raya Puasa aka Eid-ul-Fitr was celebrated on 31 March 2025 and signified the end of the fasting month of Ramadan , while Hari Raya Haji (7 June 2025) is celebrated to mark the Muslim pilgrimage (hajj), and is a day when Muslims usually perform the annual ‘korban’ ritual. Read more: Guide To Halal Restaurants & Cafés Are Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji public holidays in Singapore? Yes, Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri and Hari Raya Haji are designated as public holidays in Singapore . What is the ‘korban’ ritual? Hari Raya Haji commemorates the willingness of the Islamic prophet Ibrahim to sacrifice his son Ismail in an act of obedience to God. The korban is one of the main rituals and involves the sacrificial slaughtering of livestock such as cows, sheep or goats. The sacrifice ritual is done quickly (the jugular vein at the animal’s throat is slit quickly to ensure the quickest death possible), then the meat is cleaned and distributed to the community, the poor and needy. How is Hari Raya Puasa and Hari Raya Haji celebrated in Singapore? Image credit: Visit Singapore Hari Raya Puasa: In Singapore, Hari Raya Puasa is a vibrant celebration, with Muslim families donning their finest colourful ethnic costumes as they spend the day visiting loved ones. The festival emphasises unity, forgiveness, and the importance of family. The day kicks off with special prayers at the mosque, followed by a sermon. You’ll also see Ramadan bazaars popping up around Singapore during the month of Ramadan leading up to Hari Raya Puasa/Aidilfitri, including the biggest bazaar in Geylang Serai . These bazaars will consist of delicious food, Hari Raya goodies, festive costumes, performances and much more. Hari Raya Haji: Besides the korban ritual on Hari Raya Haji, Muslims usually congregate to perform Hari Raya Haji prayers in the morning at the mosque and then visit close family members just like they do during Hari Raya Puasa. Muslims use it as an opportunity to gather and strengthen family bonds. No Hari Raya celebration is complete without the delicious festive food! Expect a spread of festive dishes like ketupat (rice cakes), rendang (spicy meat stew), ayam masak merah (chicken in spicy tomato paste), and more. For sweet treats, every home you visit will be filled with a variety of goodies, with favourites like Makmur, Suji, and Kueh Tart.
